reviewText: Up until yesterday, I had only heard of Red Skelton, and saw a few clips on TV from time to time.  I saw this DVD in the sale rack at [a physical store] for less than seven bucks.  What could I lose since it's just over ?  After watching this short film (less than an hour) I became a full fledged fan.The prison escape is absolutely priceless.  Now I'm on Amazon looking for more Red Skelton films.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Red Skelton is one funny guy.  His comedy isn't like that of today and that it a very good thing.  This show could be called a short movie but is an hour tv show from a show I had not heard of.  The transfer is pretty good, the stort is funny and the escape scene is hilarious.  Well worth seeing.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Great Red Skelton performance.  This was an episode of "Climax" and it appears to be complete.  That is, except for the Climax opening preceding the episode and the ending credits.  The quality is good and there is no GT logo on this.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I like Red Skelton, he can be silly at times but always fun to watch. I love when he knows he goofed and laughs at himself. His work is fun and clean. Buy the whistler series, I can watch those movies every couple of months and still laugh and enjoy.
summary: Red Skelton is right up there with the best of comedians, watch and laugh, have a great time
Title: N/A

reviewText: At first, I was disappointed that this was not the movie version, but the original teleplay of "Public Pigeon No. 1". Then I watched & was completely bowled over by comedian Red Skelton's antics! What a standard feature film takes (approx. 90 mins.), this T.V. episode of "Climax" does in a compact 48 mins. About a well-meaning shnook who invests in uranium from a pair of con artists, then is set up to take the fall & is sent to prison, Skelton is simply hilarious here. An inspired clown/pantomimist, Skelton makes every joke, sight gag & facial reaction count. The prison break segment by itself is just hysterical!A nice little piece of vintage 1956 television to add to my (and your) collection!
summary: Proof that Skelton's the perfect "pigeon" for comedy
Title: N/A
